header.title: Hi, I am Tamas.
header.statement: I am a self-taught web developer who is looking for his first full-time front-end position.

description.paragraph: A big part of my bachelor studies revolved around HTML, CSS and JS in the late 2000s, and while I continued my master studies with a social/political science angle and later worked as a teacher in different institutions, my interest in coding in general never wavered.

During the second half of 2019, I refreshed my HTML, CSS and Javascript knowledge and in early 2020 I completed Udacity's FrontEnd Developer NanoDegree Program. Then I continued with learning React and its ecosystem.
I have spent this last year building projects small and big to expand my knowledge in various directions.
Some of the techs I have been working with:
One of the many small vanilla HTML/CSS/JS projects I have built as practice. The application plays sounds after certain keydowns.
A React front-end and Node.JS/Express back-end application extended with Typescript that fetches and displays news items based on various country/category selection.
The live code is currently deployed on a free tier option on Heroku, so it might need a minute or two to boot up.

A React front-end and Node.JS/Express back-end application using MongoDB to store site-specific data. The application imitates a subscription-based service site with form submit pages and a search functionality serving a public API database.
The live code is currently deployed on a free tier option on Heroku, so it might need a minute or two to boot up.

A React front-end and Node.JS/Express back-end application using MongoDB to store site-specific data. The application is a choose-your-own-adventure story game. It includes multiple adventures to choose from, form submit pages, user statistics and achievements tracking with a possibility to reset progress, different colour themes and more.
The live code is currently deployed on a free tier option on Heroku, so it might need a minute or two to boot up.
The site is a simple Gatsby generated static site extended with Typescript to showcase some of my projects.

contact.title: Contact
contact.statement: Feel free to reach out via email or LinkedIn!
